35c7e81f-3a03-400e-9eba-1600b38539b6.message: Hello Jane, I wanted to share all relevant information regarding my mental health diagnosis with you. I have been diagnosed with major depressive disorder since February 2023 and generalized anxiety disorder since December 2022. Recent assessments indicate that my depression symptoms have moderately worsened.

8dda3460-9405-410d-bb70-297d1a9c9ca3.message: Hi Jane, thank you very much for confirming the diagnoses. I wanted to bring up that a teacher mentioned Lucas is worried about his dad's 'worsening condition.' Could you please let me know if this concern is related to the recent assessment you conducted with Mark? I need to clarify this for the school counselor to better support Lucas. Please confirm once you've received this message so I know it reached you. Thanks again!

8503ac01-52d7-42c0-a066-49f5572633b0.message: Hi Emily, thank you for your message. I have received it and understand your concerns about Lucas. I will review the assessment details and get back to you shortly with information that can help clarify the situation for the school counselor.

8f1ec79c-0a29-41d9-b65b-f4c2c40a7b4c.message: Emily, regarding your question, Mark's recent assessment indicates a moderate worsening of his depression symptoms. While this is likely contributing to Lucas's concerns, please rest assured that our focus is on supporting the well-being of both Mark and Lucas. If you or the school counselor need guidance on how to best support Lucas, feel free to reach out to me.

4e6bda58-666c-4731-92ff-6bacdb3037c1.message: Thank you, Jane, for the detailed information and for reassuring us about your focus on supporting both Mark and Lucas. Could you please provide any specific guidance or recommendations that we can share with the school counselor to better support Lucas at school? Kindly confirm once you receive this message.

4e3517f3-7de7-45db-ab81-a2af9fb395da.message:
Hi Emily, thank you for your message. Here are some recommendations to support Lucas at school:

1. Encourage open communication: Allow Lucas to express his feelings and concerns freely.
2. Provide a safe and supportive environment: Ensure Lucas feels emotionally secure in school.
3. Collaborate with parents and mental health professionals: Maintain regular communication to monitor Lucas's well-being.
4. Be attentive to any changes in behavior or academic performance, and intervene early if needed.

Please let me know if the school counselor needs any further guidance or if you have other questions. I'm here to help.

f805c3e3-e769-4b92-af09-b505071c0c29.message: Thank you so much, Jane, for these thoughtful and detailed recommendations. They will be very helpful for the school counselor to support Lucas effectively. We truly appreciate your guidance and your willingness to assist further. Please confirm once you've received this message.

355296b4-7a49-45cc-852d-8e4b800ce11c.message: Hi Emily, thank you for your kind words. I have received your message, and I'm glad the recommendations are helpful. Please feel free to reach out anytime if you or the school counselor need further assistance.

c6268a7a-e83a-44c6-a966-4372e2c6ff23.message: Thank you again, Jane, for your ongoing support and collaboration. It means a lot to us. I'll be in touch if we have any further questions or needs.

Hi Emily, thank you for your message. Here are some recommendations to support Lucas at school:
